reasoning: Drug-induced liver injury (DILI) incidence estimated at 1.5 per 100k person-years based on DILI Network and epidemiological studies. Heterogeneous condition with variable presentation; confidence limited by geographic variation in drug exposure and surveillance methodology differences across regions.
source: Chalasani NP et al. (2014). Causes, clinical features, and outcomes from a national prospective study of drug-induced liver injury in the United States. Gastroenterology. 135(6):1924-1934.e1-4. DILI Network Registry.
